conclusion: Consider principles of light and shadow to determine changes in shadows.
The light source is positioned in front of the objects, casting shadows on the ground.
Shadow is formed by light source and object, resulting from light rays passing through object and reflecting on ground.
Shadows will change in position and size when light source moves to back left or right.
Position of light source affects size and shape of shadows; larger objects cast larger shadows.
Position of light source affects direction and length of shadows; longer shadows occur when light source is further from object.
Shadow of alarm clock (A) will move to back left or right; size and shape change with light source position.
Shadow of egg (B) will move to back left or right; size and shape change with light source position.
Shadow of typewriter (C) will move to back left or right; size and shape change with light source position.
Shadow of dominoes (D) will move to back left or right; size and shape change with light source position.
Position and size of shadows change depending on movement of light source.
